TopicTitle: FanWork Fridays: A Jeb Bead Sprite

Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/301cb0bc17ca76a396dc75e2651dee4d/tumblr_inline_n4z1q37sdq1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p>Gina S made a Jeb bead sprite and said it was her largest piece to date. What do you think? Seeing this, do you think KSP fit right in to the style of an old school game?</p>

<p></p>

I'd say it'd fit fine...

(Credit to Managore)

Edited May 3, 2014 by ObsessedWithKSP

*sniffs*

Hmmmmm, I do love me some good pixel art.
I am loving it. Although, it probably took hours. Hours the creator could have invested in playing KSP. As such, 3/10
That is not Jeb... he is not exhillarated enough. Might be Bob or Bill.

Next step: Light Bright!

(for those under 35 years old, you may have to Google it)
The eyes are backwards. It drives me crazy when people flip the eyes.

The eyes are backwards. It drives me crazy when people flip the eyes.

Sorry, but they look OK to me. Do you mean they are inside-out or what? The shadows underneath the eyeballs make it quite clear they are bulging out perfectly Kerbal-like.
Oh, he means that the kerbal has the right eye slightly larger than the left, when it should be the other way around.
Yeah, it's not too noticeable, but a kerbal's left eye is slightly larger. (Technically, it would be the right eye to the kerbal, but to us looking at hem it's left.)

Yeah, it's not too noticeable, but a kerbal's left eye is slightly larger. (Technically, it would be the right eye to the kerbal, but to us looking at hem it's left.)

Wow. I wonder why...

Wow. I wonder why...

Cartoonist psychology. It makes them look goofier.
